name: Project Tracking Improvements
description: Added a Portfolio section to the TeamHQ landing page that showcases the team's completed work with rich data — agent contributions, task breakdowns, decisions, file deliverables, and summary statistics.

tasks.title: Scoped requirements for project tracking improvements
subtasks: Analyzed data/tasks.json — found 9 projects with per-agent tasks, subtasks, decisions, and filesChanged
Identified that rich task data was invisible on the landing page (old tasks.js disconnected)
Scoped Portfolio section: summary stats, project cards, expandable task breakdowns, contributor highlights, decision rollups
Defined 6 requirements (R1-R6) with detailed acceptance criteria
Specified technical constraints: plain HTML/CSS/vanilla JS, no backend changes, no new dependencies
Wrote implementation notes for Robert, Alice, and Enzo
decisions: New Portfolio section between Projects and Meetings — keeps active project management separate from historical showcase
Static JSON over Express API — portfolio showcases historical work, not real-time management
Nested accordion for task details — reuses established grid-template-rows pattern
Deferred filtering, timeline viz, and search to keep v1 focused

tasks.title: Create design spec for Portfolio section
subtasks: Defined section placement between Projects and Meetings with nav link
Designed stats row with 6 metric cards (flex layout, responsive wrapping)
Designed project cards with status badges, agent avatars, date, chevron
Specified expandable card details with grid-template-rows animation
Designed per-project metrics row, task list reusing existing .task-item patterns
Created contributors summary with avatar, name, subtask/file counts
Designed key decisions rollup with collapsible accordion
Specified responsive breakpoints: mobile 2-col stats, tablet 3-col, desktop 6-col
Documented full accessibility requirements (aria-expanded, aria-hidden, focus-visible, reduced-motion)
Defined animation specs consistent with existing patterns
decisions: Reuse existing .task-item CSS classes for task breakdown — no new classes needed for task details
Agent avatars hidden on mobile to save space
Only project-level accordion is one-at-a-time — nested task expansion is independent
Key decisions section collapsed by default to save space

tasks.title: Implement Portfolio section UI
subtasks: Created js/portfolio.js with IIFE pattern matching existing tasks.js — fetches data/tasks/index.json, loads each project JSON, computes aggregate stats, renders full Portfolio section
Added Portfolio section HTML to index.html between Projects and Meetings with proper semantic structure (section, aria-labelledby, container wrapper)
Added Portfolio nav link between Projects and Meetings in the navigation bar
Implemented summary stats row with 6 metric cards: Projects, Completed, Agents, Tasks, Files, Decisions — all computed dynamically from task data
Built portfolio project cards with status badges (reusing project-card badge treatment), agent avatar clusters with overlap and +N overflow, completion dates, and chevron expand/collapse
Implemented one-at-a-time project accordion with grid-template-rows animation matching existing patterns
Added per-project metrics row (tasks, files, decisions) at the top of expanded details
Rendered task breakdown lists reusing existing .task-item patterns with agent SVG avatars instead of letter initials, nested independent accordion for subtasks/files/decisions
Built contributors summary section ordered by subtask count with avatar, name, and contribution stats
Implemented key decisions rollup as collapsible accordion, collapsed by default, aggregating decisions from all agents with agent attribution
Added full responsive CSS: mobile 2-col stats with truncated descriptions and hidden avatars, tablet 3-col, desktop 6-col
Added accessibility: all interactive elements are buttons with aria-expanded/aria-hidden, focus-visible outlines, keyboard Enter/Space support, reduced-motion media query
Added pending status treatment (gray dot) to .task-item__status CSS
decisions: Used SVG avatar images in task items instead of initial letters — provides richer visual identity consistent with the rest of the landing page
Added escapeHTML utility for all user-facing text — prevents potential XSS from task data content
Added pending status to both formatStatus and CSS — data includes pending tasks not covered by existing status treatments
Kept portfolio.js as separate file rather than merging with tasks.js — each section is self-contained per existing architecture
